meanings.definition: A person who works a piece of land for a share of the crops produced.
meanings.sent1: The sharecroppers harvested the corn and divided it among themselves.
meanings.sent2: The sharecroppers planted cotton and shared the profits with the landowner.
meanings.sent3: The sharecroppers joked about having to split the vegetables like they were playing a game.
meanings.sent4: The sharecroppers were like bees, each gathering their portion of the sweet honey.
meanings.sent5: The sharecroppers toiled under the sun, each earning their share of the harvest.

meanings.definition: A tenant farmer who gives a share of the crops grown to the landowner as rent.
meanings.sent1: After the harvest, the sharecroppers handed over a portion of the crops to the landowner.
meanings.sent2: The sharecroppers delivered their share of the produce to the landlord every season.
meanings.sent3: The sharecroppers playfully pretended to pay the landowner with imaginary fruits.
meanings.sent4: The sharecroppers were like rivers, flowing their crops back to the landowner.
meanings.sent5: The sharecroppers fulfilled their agreement by offering a portion of their hard-earned crops.
